_header: For full fain I would do that might you please
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 419.
Title(s): The Romans of Partenay or of Lusigen (The Tale of Melusine)
_description: The Romans of Partenay or of Lusigen (The Tale of Melusine) — 6615 lines in rhyme royal stanzas

CamTCC597.First Lines:
…For full fayne I wold do that myght you pleaseyff connyng I
                    had in it to procede…
CamTCC597.Last Lines:
…Though that diffautes appere huge to eyYut excusith me besech
                    you hertly
CamTCC597.Editions:
Skeat,  Walter William,
                        ed.  
             The Romans of Partenay or of Lusignen.

         o.s. 20 (1866); repr. 1987.
